formalText: She has no insurance, and also doesn't have any information yet.
When she gets it, she will give it to me and I will bill it and see how that goes.
She doesn't have the name of the person who prescribes for her. But the guy prescribed nothing for her sleep issues. He didn't think she needed antidepressants anymore
He said he wanted to check in again in six weeks.
This is a psychiatrist
which is pretty aggressive about the sleep stuff.
She is  thinking it might be good to get a new prescriber because she did not have a good relationship.
Told her to email me the list of people in your insurance in the area.
I can look through it and see if there's someone I recommend
Suggested that they should just see a couples counselor together about it.
We will talk more about her trip next time.
She says, "I'm tired and cranky and not feeling well
like emotionally
and physically
She feels like it's always been a really really hard time and she has had suicide in the back of her mind but never made plans.
She has had a headache all day and it's been resistant to painkillers both over-the-counter and prescription.
Dave and her have been fighting a lot the last couple of days.
She has been feeling really low, and her mood has been lower the past week and a half to two weeks than it has been in quite a while.
She says. " I am almost like a little kid having a meltdown.
just that they are too tired and they need to go to sleep.
But then she describes it as completely losing all grip on reality and feeling like everything is overwhelming and that she can't do anything.
She says, "It's just I can't sleep ever in terms of her insomnia. More info in Review of Systems.
She was telling Dave she was really frustrated that she couldn't get to sleep and it has been causing conflict. He has been telling her to take supplements for it
She said "things have been rough with me and Dave and I don't know what to do about it because I know living with me isn't easy
I'm a pain in the ass to live with in some regards".
She is utterly overwhelmed.
She told her husband "I was feeling low and that I was just really upset about a lot of things and I've been having his meltdowns at the end of the day".
These meltdowns are really stressful for Dave to witness.
She really tries to keep them bottled up and not expose him to it
She has been tired of having this shaky self-control the last week or so.
She thinks it is selfish to dump all her internal Chaos on him and not provide better buffering and to rely on him as much as she does
It drives her crazy.
He won't tell her what he's feeling.
Her husband has ADHD.
So he takes Concerta which is one of those drugs for you kind of have to go see a physician in person every 3 months because of FDA regulations.
He also does psychoanalysis therapy.
Said, "The first time I wanted to kill myself, I was 11.
I ate a pack of my parents cigarettes.
It was not a very pleasant plan.
They made me throw up".
She was really isolated throughout her entire childhood.
She had no friends at all.
She was tormented at school and tormented at home.
There's always been a thought in the back of her head that things are good now but don't expect them to stay good saying
"You can always kill yourself tomorrow if they stopping good"
There was a time last winter when she was pretty close to taking some pills.
It was why she fired her previous therapist.
There was a lot that she didn't like about the treatment plan that she had.
She had been wanting to kill myself the point where she was hoarding pills and she got scared and had to ask Dave to come home.
Her psychiatrist completely blew that off and redirected the conversation talking about her dad
The sleep issue is clearly putting a strain on her relationship
Maybe her father has PTSD
She says, "I hate my parents
That's all"
She has so much trouble getting to sleep staying asleep.
She has been feeling really bad about the whole insomnia situation and that it's not getting any better.
"I'll be completely exhausted at work at my desk falling asleep or sitting at home in my home study or on the couch not enough as soon as I get to bed.
Then I'm wide awake and I can't get to sleep.
It's really frustrating.
Until 2 or 3 in the morning I can't sleep
She eventually conks out.
She usually wakes up two or three times a night.
She is sleeping about 5 hours or so with two or three interruptions in an ongoing way.
Ambien doesn't work.
She was trying Ambien, but it just doesn't knock her out.
She tried trazodone which is an antidepressant and hypnotic.
It will knock her out, but then she will sleep for 10 hours and feel hungover when she wakes up.
She had the same problem with Benadryl.

This psychiatrist got really aggressive about monitoring her sleep hygiene and telling her she had terrible sleep hygiene and to do better and the sleep problems would just go away if she followed the rules better.
For suicidal, she is
Not close enough to actually be contemplating making plans
But close enough to be thinking about it.
